title: The Red Carnation
provenance_text:
Max Weber [1881-1961], Great Neck, NY until October 1944 [1]; Paul Rosenberg & Co., New York, NY, until October 19, 1944 [2]; Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), October 19, 1944 until April 1, 1973 [3]; his bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, February 1974.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 19 in the exhibition "Painting in the United States" held at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October-December, 1944.
[2]. Mr. Rosenberg was the artist's agent. See copies of correspondence in curatorial file.
[3]. Mr. Rosenbloom purchased the painting from the above referenced exhibition for $1,200 (his check was dated October 19, 1944; receipt was acknowledged by Mr. Rosenberg on October 21, 1944.)

creator.death_place: Great Neck (Nassau county, New York state, United States)
